snippet: The 124-year-old Carroll Street Bridge in Brooklyn, a 107-foot-long link between Park Slope and Carroll Gardens, sustained damage from flooding in Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Carroll Street Bridge, relic of the late 19th century, which today connects Carroll Gardens with Park Slope, is undergoing repair for damage from Hurricane Sandy; is one of the oldest of New York City’s 25 movable bridges and the only wooden bridge that carries cars; overhaul is expected to take five months.
lead_paragraph: The 124-year-old Carroll Street Bridge in Brooklyn, a 107-foot-long link between Park Slope and Carroll Gardens, sustained damage from flooding in Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Beloved, Tiny Bridge in Brooklyn Is Opened for Repairs
headline.main: Antique Bridge Closed to Traffic While It’s Open for Repairs
headline.print_headline: Antique Bridge Closed to Traffic While It’s Open For Repairs
